description: Fols. 298; 25.7 x 17 cm.; written surface 22.5 x 14 cm.; 36 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; with vowel signs; with catchwords. A commentary on al-Kifāyah fī al-naḥw, a work on grammar by the author. Beg.: بسم الله ... الله احمد على ما الجم من نعمه واسدى وافاد من کرمه ... اما بعد فاعلم ان اللغة العربىة اشرف اللغات Ending: ... امکنة مسکونة او خاوىة تجري المسکونة في الاهتداء بها الى A few marginal notes and glosses. Stated on title page that copy was made during the lifetime of the author. MS incomplete at end; in fair condition; stained with dampness; Arabic leather binding with flap; gilt stamped and tooling on cover; blind tooling on cover and flap and blind stamped on flap. Probably unique. Probably from XIIIth century. Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925. Suyūṭī, Bughyat al-wuʻāh (1908), p. 131; Ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), VI, p. 404.
author: Ibn al-Khabbāz, Aḥmad ibn al-Ḥusayn, 1193-1240
creator: Ibn al-Khabbāz, Aḥmad ibn al-Ḥusayn, 1193-1240
subject: Ibn al-Khabbāz, Aḥmad ibn al-Ḥusayn, 1193-1240—Kifāyah fī al-naḥw
